abstract: With the rapid development of computer technology in recent years, CG art has gradually entered the ranks of mainstream visual art and received more attention. CG art refers to digital visual technology works created by computer, graphic design software, digital photography technology and computer-aided drawing software. The communication platform of CG art is mainly online, while the research on ...
articleTitle: Evaluation System of CG Art Communication Platform Based on User Experience
xml:
SECTION I.

Introduction

With the development of science and technology and the continuous improvement of computer technology, the visual creation based on computer technology have gradually matured. All parts of the world are used to calling the visual design and production field using computer technology CG.

“CG” was originally the abbreviation of Computer Graphics. With the formation of a series of related industries that use computers as the main tool for visual design and production, it is customary internationally to call visual design using computer technology CG. It shortens the cycle of manual painting and realizes materials and visual effects that are difficult to achieve by hand [1]. CG originated in the 1970s and was developed abroad at the earliest time. It is an art category closely integrated with technology. It better provides software support for artists to exert their imagination. Artists can skillfully combine rational thinking ability with perceptual artistic inspiration to create a virtual world that traditional art cannot express. The wonderful virtual world, the real interaction between people and art, and the bright visual impact are all unprecedented experiences brought by CG art [2].

In communication science, communication refers to the process of information sharing and exchange between people through symbols to transfer information, ideas, attitudes and feelings. And art is a cultural phenomenon created by people to better meet their comfort needs for subjective defects and the behavioral needs of emotional organs [3], so is CG art. The key task of art communication is to present art information where the audience’s senses can reach, guide them to achieve their perception of art information, and trigger the expected emotional experience [4]. CG art, as a kind of visual art, has developed rapidly in recent years due to the influence of technology. As an art form based on computer technology, online communication has also become the main form of communication. The online communication of CG art has a high similarity with traditional visual art, but there are also differences in user experience.

With the development of CG art, CG art communication platforms are also gradually diversified. At present, CG art communication platforms are mainly divided into the following categories: commercial CG art platforms, which have the functions of art works trading and providing related job opportunities; CG art platform for learning, providing related technical courses, related competition information sharing and other functions; As well as a comprehensive visual art platform that is not purely CG art communication, including CG art related sections. The existing CG art platform mainly includes the following functional modules: work sharing, related activities (competitions), community exchanges, learning tutorials, trading platforms, etc. The existing mainstream CG art platforms include “Artstation”, “DeviantArt”, “CG Society”, “GGAC”, etc. Their development direction is mainly focused on content quality and interactive experience, and the research on user experience is still blank.

While the content quality of various online platforms continue to develop, user experience has become increasingly important with the diversification of user needs. The content quality of online platforms are no longer a single indicator of user experience, and the user interaction experience when using the platform has become one of the main contents of the design. User experience evaluation is an important part of user experience research. Traditional user emotional experience evaluation is a kind of perceptual evaluation that is difficult to quantify. Some subjective indicators are used for statistical analysis. With the development of academia, the objectivity of evaluation begins to rise. Researchers use analytic hierarchy process, factor analysis, fuzzy comprehensive evaluation, and other methods to analyze data to obtain more scientific conclusions. Make the evaluation system more scientific and rigorous.

Online CG art communication platform does not have specific user experience evaluation conducted by previous researchers, and the evaluation system of online websites with a wider range also has certain reference value. When Abd EI Aleem et al. studied how to measure the efficiency of e-commerce websites, they used home page response time, average page size of websites, total pages, number of links to other websites, etc. as input indicators, and took the average number of users’ daily click and the average number of daily independent visitors as output indicators to build a new evaluation standard model [5]. Li et al. built a quantitative evaluation index system of university websites with 10 indicators including the number of visits, click on rate, and total links to three aspects of traffic, links, and speed based on webometrics [6]. But in terms of the use and evaluation of indicators, there are still problems that cannot be related to the user experience commendably. The indicators are not targeted, so they cannot be well applied to all online platforms.

This research mainly solves the problem of user experience evaluation of online CG art communication platform. Sums up the user experience evaluation system by using grounded theory and uses the AHP judgment matrix to obtain the weight of each index. Introduce fuzzy comprehensive evaluation into the application of evaluation system, reduces the subjective factors in the evaluation process as much as possible, provides a basis for emotional experience evaluation with a more scientific method. Finally, a complete evaluation system is summarized to provide a basis for subsequent research.

SECTION II.

Theoretical Backgroung

A. User Experience

User experience refers to all feelings of users before, during and after using a product or system, including emotion, cognition, behavior and other aspects [7]. The research on user experience should be carried out in psychology and related fields at the earliest. Psychological experts define user experience as an emotion [8]. In the mid-1990s, Norman and Miller [9] proposed and promoted the concept of user experience, making it known to the public. He proposed that user experience can be embodied and applied to all aspects of products and services. Combining multiple disciplines including engineering, marketing, industrial design, etc. On the basis of meeting user needs, design products that make users feel satisfied and cheerful [10]. This paper mainly discusses the user experience of CG art platform.

B. User Experience Evaluation

User experience evaluation is an important part of user experience research. Law believes that the practicality and effectiveness of building a user experience model is obvious. Through research and analysis, he believes that the user experience evaluation model should include two parts: a measurement model and a structural model. It also constructs a user experience structure model from four aspects: user enjoyment, product aesthetics, usability and overall product quality [11]. Park et al. have determined five quantitative models through research to study the relationship between the overall user experience, the elements of user experience and the sub elements of user experience elements. These five quantitative models are respectively the linear models commonly used in the product usability evaluation research in the human-computer interaction field, as well as the nonlinear model, the S-value model, the joint model and the extraction model [12]. Hassenzahl et al. believe that the satisfaction of users’ psychological needs (security, autonomy, relevance, etc.) was the main source of positive emotional experience of interaction between users and products. And built a user experience evaluation structure model based on users’ psychological needs, subjective feelings, and interactive products [13]. O’Brien and Toms built a structural model of user participation based on previous research. Through reliability analysis and exploratory factor analysis, they determined six indicators to measure user participation: perceived usability, product aesthetics, concentration, sensory relevance, novelty and adaptability [14].

C. Grounded Theory

Rooting theory is a kind of research and analysis method developed by Anselm Strauss and Barney Glaser of Columbia University [15]. It is a qualitative research method that uses professional and systematic processes to inductively derive grounded theories for the development trend of a certain current situation. Relevant researchers did not have a certain hypothesis before studying a certain problem. They directly obtained the basis of the hypothesis from the original data. After sorting, analyzing and summarizing, it rose to the system. This is a construction method from basic data to system theory, which to explore the relationship between things and phenomena in the process of sorting, analyzing and summarizing the original data, and to rise to a systematic theory according to the conceptual relationship between people.

This study intends to use the grounded theory to initially extract the evaluation indicators of CG art platform user experience and establish the hierarchical relationship of each indicator. The grounded theory is a systematic hierarchical relationship based on the induction and generalization of raw materials, which can solve the problems of subjectivity and non systematicness that often occur in other qualitative research methods. And provide scientific theoretical basis and practical operation basis for establishing the hierarchical relationship of user experience evaluation indicators that can directly represent the opinions of a wide range of users.

D. Delphi Method

Delphi method, also known as expert investigation method. Founded and implemented by RAND Corporation in 1946, it is essentially a feedback anonymous correspondence method. The general process is to collate, summarize and count the problems to be predicted after obtaining the opinions of experts, and then give anonymous feedback to all experts, again ask for opinions, again concentrate, and then give feedback until consensus is reached. This method is a method in which an enterprise forms a special forecasting organization, including several experts and enterprise forecasting organizers, and in accordance with the prescribed procedures, back-to-back solicits experts’ opinions or judgments on the future market, and then forecasts.

E. Analytic Hierarchy Process

AHP is a practical multi-attribute evaluation method proposed by Professor Saaty of the University of Pittsburgh in 1971 [16]. it’s a hierarchical and systematic analysis method [20], [21], [22] of multi-criteria decision-making (MCDM) [17], [18], [19] combined with qualitative and quantitative. It divides decision elements into different dimensions and hierarchically decomposes them, and then evaluates and integrates them. So that complex decision-making problems can be systematically solved. This method can reduce the risk of decision-making errors and has become a significant decision-making method. In addition, this method is also a common method to determine the weight of indicators in evaluation decision-making. At present, AHP has been combined a variety of methods and technologies, widely used in model construction, risk assessment and countermeasures proposed aspect [19] for industry and production [23], [24], geography and environment [25], [26], energy and sustainable development [27], [28], economy [29], [30], education [31] and other fields. The feasibility and openness provides a basis of the construction of the evaluation model based on UE in this research.

F. Fussy Comprehensive Evaluation

The multi-level fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method is an evaluation method that combines qualitative and quantitative analysis based on fuzzy theory [32]. It is a research method based on the theory of fuzzy mathematics, applying the principles of fuzzy sets and membership theory. According to the membership theory of fuzzy mathematics, qualitative evaluation is transformed into quantitative evaluation. Using fuzzy mathematics to make an overall evaluation of things or objects restricted by a variety of factors. And quantifying some uncertain, unclear extension, and difficult to quantitative analysis factors, to conduct comprehensive evaluation. It has the characteristics of clear results and strong systematicness, can better solve fuzzy and difficult to quantify problems. It is suitable for solving various uncertain problems.

SECTION III.

Establishment of Evaluation System

In this study, qualitative and quantitative research methods are used. The qualitative data of the evaluation system are obtained by network survey, grounded theory and Delphi method. The quantitative index weight is obtained by using the analytic hierarchy process, and the evaluation model is constructed. Finally, the questionnaire data obtained were tested for differences. The fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method is used to comprehensively evaluate the experimental results, and the whole evaluation process is built into a standardized evaluation system.

The overall research process architecture of user experience of CG art communication platform is shown in Figure 1.

FIGURE 1.

Overall research process.

Show All

A. Obtain Evaluation Indicators

Through the data collection of relevant CG art communication platforms, this research has obtained a large number of initial informations about the user experience of CG art communication platforms from users. Through open coding, axial coding and selective coding. Core categories are extracted from the original information, and relationships between categories are established. Finally, according to the coding results, an evaluation system for this research is constructed. A total of 56 nodes were formed in the open coding process, and 16 categories (B1-B16) were obtained by merging nodes with similar connotations. The contents and categories of some coding source data are shown in Table 1.

TABLE 1 Open Coding

Through the open coding of raw materials, 16 categories (B1-B16) were first obtained. Spindle coding is carried out to discover and establish various relationships between conceptual categories. Finally, four main categories (A1-A4) are formed. Through the coding analysis of the remaining half of the original data, no new concept category has been found. Therefore, it is considered that the theory has reached saturation and can be summarized in the next step. Axial coding process is shown in Table 2.

TABLE 2 Axial Coding

Through open coding and axial coding, this study summarized 16 categories and 4 main categories. And through the analysis of the original materials, the connotation of the category is described. On this basis, the user experience evaluation system of CG art communication platform is constructed, as shown in Figure 2.

FIGURE 2.

User experience evaluation system.

Show All

B. Calculation of Weight

The AHP is used to determine the weight of evaluation indicators, which mainly includes four steps: comparison of indicator importance, construction of complementary judgment matrix, calculation of each indicator weight value and consistency test.

Invite n interviewees to compare and score the importance of each evaluation index with 1-9 evaluation scale. See Table 3 for the evaluation scale.

TABLE 3 Scale Definition Table

According to the results of paired comparison of evaluation indicators, a judgement matrix is established.

First, normalize each column of the judgment matrix.\begin{equation*} \overline { a_{ij}} = \frac {a_{ij}}{\sum \nolimits _{k=1}^{n} a_{kj}}, ({\it i,j} =1,2,\ldots,n)\tag{1}\end{equation*} View Source\begin{equation*} \overline { a_{ij}} = \frac {a_{ij}}{\sum \nolimits _{k=1}^{n} a_{kj}}, ({\it i,j} =1,2,\ldots,n)\tag{1}\end{equation*}

The normalized judgment matrix is summed by row.\begin{equation*} \overline W_{i} =\sum \nolimits _{j=1}^{n} \overline {a_{ij}}, (i =1, 2, \ldots, n)\tag{2}\end{equation*} View Source\begin{equation*} \overline W_{i} =\sum \nolimits _{j=1}^{n} \overline {a_{ij}}, (i =1, 2, \ldots, n)\tag{2}\end{equation*}

Normalize vectors $\overline W =\left [{ w_{1},w_{2}\ldots w_{n} }\right]^{T}$ .\begin{equation*} W=\frac {\overline W_{i}}{\sum \nolimits _{j=1}^{n} \overline {wj}}\mathrm { }, (i =1, 2, \ldots, n)\tag{3}\end{equation*} View Source\begin{equation*} W=\frac {\overline W_{i}}{\sum \nolimits _{j=1}^{n} \overline {wj}}\mathrm { }, (i =1, 2, \ldots, n)\tag{3}\end{equation*}

Calculate the maximum eigenvalue of the judgment matrix.\begin{equation*} \lambda _{max}=\frac {1}{n}\sum \nolimits _{i=1}^{n} \frac {(Aw)i}{wi}\tag{4}\end{equation*} View Source\begin{equation*} \lambda _{max}=\frac {1}{n}\sum \nolimits _{i=1}^{n} \frac {(Aw)i}{wi}\tag{4}\end{equation*} (Aw)i represent the “i”th element of the vector Aw.

C. Consistency Inspection

After getting ${\lambda }_{max}$ , the consistency test is performed on the judgment matrix to determine whether the weight distribution previously calculated is reasonable. The process of conformance inspection is as follows.

Calculate the consistency index CI of judgment matrix A. \begin{equation*} CI=\frac {\lambda _{max}-n}{n-1}\tag{5}\end{equation*} View Source\begin{equation*} CI=\frac {\lambda _{max}-n}{n-1}\tag{5}\end{equation*}

Find the average random consistency index Rl of the judgment matrix. Values of judgment matrix of order $1\sim 15$ are shown in the table 5.

TABLE 4 Judgement Matrix
TABLE 5 Random Consistency and Corresponding Values

Calculate the consistency ratio CR \begin{equation*} CR=\frac {CI}{RI}\tag{6}\end{equation*} View Source\begin{equation*} CR=\frac {CI}{RI}\tag{6}\end{equation*}

In the research of AHP, the random consistency ratio CR of judgment matrix is used for consistency test. Generally, when CR< 0.1, the consistency of the judgment matrix is acceptable, otherwise, the factors in matrix A need to be adjusted to meet the consistency requirements.

D. Practical Application of the Method

The Delphi method is essentially a feedback anonymous correspondence method and an iterative method based on consensus. It converts various opinions into consensus [33], [34]. Its anonymous response form makes the collected opinions more independent and credible [35]. This research invited 3 design graduates from East China University of Science and Technology, 2 designers with CG creation experience, and 3 graduate students who have continued to pay attention to CG art and have been paying attention to mainstream CG art platforms for more than one year to form the recipients, exchange and discuss the CG art platform. Scoring the relative importance of 4 primary indicators and 16 secondary indicators respectively. Finally through two rounds of feedback, a total of 12 first level indicator judgment matrices and 48 second level indicator judgment matrices are established. The average value is calculated to obtain the final 5 judgment matrices.

Taking the secondary indicators (information acquisition, data recording, program protection, privacy protection, copyright protection) under functional experience as an example. The judgment matrix is constructed as shown in Table 6.

TABLE 6 Function Experience Judgement Matrix

The index weight is obtained after summation and normalization, and the maximum characteristic root is calculated.\begin{align*} AW=&A(primitivematrix)W(weight) \\ AW=&\left |{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 1.000 & 5.000 & 3.000 & 3.000 & 2.000\\ 0.200 & 1.000 & 0.500 & 0.500 & 0.333\\ 0.333 & 2.000 & 1.000 & 1.000 & 0.500\\ 0.333 & 2.000 & 1.000 & 1.000 & 0.500\\ 0.500 & 3.000 & 2.000 & 2.000 & 1.000\\ \end{array}} }\right | \\&\times \, \left |{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 0.414\\ 0.074\\ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 0.135\\ 0.135\\ 0.241\\ \end{array}}\\ \end{array}} }\right |=\left |{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 2.076\\ 0.372\\ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 0.676\\ 0.676\\ 1.210\\ \end{array}}\\ \end{array}} }\right | \\ \lambda max=&1.003+1.005+1.001+1.001+1.004=5.014 \\ \mathrm {CI}=&\frac {\mathrm {\lambda max-n}}{n-1}=0.004_{\mathrm {, {}}}\mathrm {CR=}\frac {CI}{RI}=0.003< 0.1\end{align*} View Source\begin{align*} AW=&A(primitivematrix)W(weight) \\ AW=&\left |{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 1.000 & 5.000 & 3.000 & 3.000 & 2.000\\ 0.200 & 1.000 & 0.500 & 0.500 & 0.333\\ 0.333 & 2.000 & 1.000 & 1.000 & 0.500\\ 0.333 & 2.000 & 1.000 & 1.000 & 0.500\\ 0.500 & 3.000 & 2.000 & 2.000 & 1.000\\ \end{array}} }\right | \\&\times \, \left |{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 0.414\\ 0.074\\ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 0.135\\ 0.135\\ 0.241\\ \end{array}}\\ \end{array}} }\right |=\left |{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 2.076\\ 0.372\\ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} 0.676\\ 0.676\\ 1.210\\ \end{array}}\\ \end{array}} }\right | \\ \lambda max=&1.003+1.005+1.001+1.001+1.004=5.014 \\ \mathrm {CI}=&\frac {\mathrm {\lambda max-n}}{n-1}=0.004_{\mathrm {, {}}}\mathrm {CR=}\frac {CI}{RI}=0.003< 0.1\end{align*}

The CR is less than 0.1, indicating that the consistency test result meets the requirements and the weight value of each index is reasonable. The calculation steps for other indicators are similar, with CR values less than 0.1. It indicates that all indicators have passed the consistency test, as shown in Table 8.

TABLE 7 Normalized Matrix
TABLE 8 CR of Each First-Level Index

The judgment matrix of other secondary indicators is shown in Table 9–Table 12.

TABLE 11 Interactive Experience Judgement Matrix

The final evaluation system is shown in Figure 3.

FIGURE 3.

Final evaluation system.

Show All

E. Reliablity and Validity Test

In order to verify the reliability and validity of the evaluation system obtained, the “Website GGAC User Experience Evaluation Questionnaire” was issued for users using the website GGAC. A total of 104 questionnaires were distributed, and 100 valid questionnaires were recovered. SPSS 26.0 was used to analyze the questionnaire data.

Reliability analysis is to check whether the sample data is reliable. Generally, internal consistency test is conducted to verify whether the measurement of the item is the same kind of problem [36], [37]. The Cronbach’s alpha is used as the test value of the scale reliability. If it is greater than 0.8, it is considered that the scale has high consistency, that is, it has high reliability and can be used. If the coefficient $\alpha $ is less than 0.6, it indicates that the reliability is poor and the problem item needs to be modified. SPSS 26.0 is used to analyze the relative weight data of CG art communication platform user experience evaluation indicators. Coefficient $\alpha $ is 0.925, indicating that the index weight has high reliability. Analyze the data of the questionnaire, coefficient $\alpha $ is 0.966, indicating that the evaluation model has high reliability.

SPSS 26.0 is used to conduct exploratory factor analysis on the data of 16 indicators in the questionnaire. Kaiser-Meyer-Olkin (KMO) value is 0.727, greater than 0.6, and the significance level of Bartlett test for sphericity is less than 0.05. The cumulative variance contribution rate of 4 factors divided into 16 items is 86.843%. There is no serious deviation in the corresponding relationship between items and factors. The factor load on the corresponding factors of 16 items is greater than 0.5. Therefore, the evaluation model has passed the validity test and has good validity.

SECTION IV.

Application of Evaluation Model

Based on the research idea of comparative analysis, this paper selects three websites - “Artstation”, “Pinterest” and “GGAC”. “Artstation” is a famous platform for the dissemination of CG art works abroad, which contains a large number of CG art works of rich variety and high quality. It is also a platform for most CG lovers to gather. “Pinterest” is a famous website for sharing visual art works. CG art is only a part of it, so it can be used as a CG art platform containing other visual art works as the research object. “GGAC” is a famous CG art sharing platform in China, which contains a wide range of high-quality CG art works. The three websites represent three types of CG art communication platforms, and the comparative study is of high research value.

This research took three websites as cases, and took students at school and CG enthusiasts of all ages who participate in work as the survey objects. Collected data by means of questionnaires. Based on the user experience evaluation system of CG art communication platform built above, a questionnaire was designed and randomly distributed to the respondents. A total of 104 questionnaires were sent out and 100 were returned. The questionnaire was designed in the form of Likert scale, which was divided into five grades: strongly agree, agree, neutral, disagree and strongly disagree. The corresponding values were 100, 85, 70, 55 and 40. The data collected from the questionnaire is used to illustrate the application of the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation based on the analytic hierarchy process in the user experience evaluation of CG art platform.

A. Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation

The multi-level fuzzy comprehensive evaluation needs to evaluate the underlying factors first, and then conduct the evaluation layer by layer until the final evaluation result is obtained [38]. To solve the final evaluation result of CG art communication platform user experience by using the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method, the criteria layer and the target layer should be calculated layer by layer. Set the indicator’s comment set $\text{V}=$ {$\text{v}_{1}$ , $\text{v}_{2}$ ,…, $\text{v}_{\mathrm {f}}$ ,…, $\text{v}_{\mathrm {k}}$ }, where vf is the f-level comment in the k-level evaluation criteria. Establish a fuzzy subset of the indicator layer for evaluation. Obtain the membership degree r of the indicator in the comment set $r_{if}$ , and normalize. Establish the fuzzy relationship matrix of the membership of each index, as shown in Formula 7.\begin{equation*} R=(r_{if})nk\tag{7}\end{equation*} View Source\begin{equation*} R=(r_{if})nk\tag{7}\end{equation*}

The evaluation result vector $\text{F}=$ WR$=$ (R1, R2, $\cdots $ , $\text{R}_{\mathrm {n}}$ ) of the criterion layer is synthesized from the known weight vector $\text{W}=$ (W1, W2, $\cdots $ , $\text{W}_{\mathrm {n}}$ ) and the fuzzy matrix R.

The evaluation matrix is established according to the evaluation results of the criterion layer. The fuzzy evaluation matrix of the target layer is obtained by weighting the comprehensive weight of the criterion layer, as shown in Formula (8). Finally, the evaluation results are selected according to the principle of maximum membership.\begin{align*} F=WR=W\left [{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} F_{1}\\ F_{2}\\ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} \vdots \\ F_{n}\\ \end{array}}\\ \end{array}} }\right]=W\left [{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} W_{1}R_{1}\\ W_{2}R_{2}\\ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} \vdots \\ W_{n}R_{n}\\ \end{array}}\\ \end{array}} }\right]\tag{8}\end{align*} View Source\begin{align*} F=WR=W\left [{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} F_{1}\\ F_{2}\\ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} \vdots \\ F_{n}\\ \end{array}}\\ \end{array}} }\right]=W\left [{ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} W_{1}R_{1}\\ W_{2}R_{2}\\ {\begin{array}{cccccccccccccccccccc} \vdots \\ W_{n}R_{n}\\ \end{array}}\\ \end{array}} }\right]\tag{8}\end{align*}

B. Questionnaire Evaluation Results

It can be seen from this that the evaluation result of the website “Artstation” is good, which is above the middle level of the industry. It can meet the needs of creators and CG art lovers. At the same time, there is room for improvement and enhancement. For example, in terms of emotional experience, “user rewards” and “personalized needs”, there is much room for improvement.

The evaluation result of the website “Pinterest” is good, which is above the middle level of the industry. It can meet the needs of creators and CG art lovers. The overall level of emotional experience is good. However, compared with the other two websites, there is still room for improvement in content experience and interaction experience.

The evaluation result of the website “GGAC” is good, which is above the middle level of the industry. It can meet the needs of creators and CG art lovers. The overall level is slightly lower than that of “Artstation”. At the same time, there is much room for improvement in the emotional experience part.

SECTION V.

User Experience Evaluation Framework

The evaluation system can be used for single product evaluation and product comparison evaluation. These two application methods are used to build evaluation process for the two application methods. The flow chart is shown in Figure 4.

FIGURE 4.

User experience evaluation process.

Show All

For the evaluation of a single product, a questionnaire is first issued to product users, and 16 secondary indicators are scored respectively. According to the results of the pre-test, invalid sample data is excluded. Secondly, the membership matrix of the initial data is obtained, and the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation vector is calculated to obtain the final score of the first level index of the product. If the index score is higher than the average and more than 75 points, it will be maintained as an advantage item; If the index score is lower than the average value and less than 70, the direct score of the secondary index shall be analyzed and improved. Focusing on the secondary index that is lower than the average score, and targeted improvement shall be made to bring better user experience; If the index score is approximately equal to the average value, then look for opportunities to improve and become an advantage item. Finally, the final fuzzy comprehensive evaluation vector of the product and score is calculated, which is compared with the evaluation criteria.

For the comparative evaluation of products, first, select the same type of competitive products as the comparative research object. Recruit users of two or more products to score two or more products respectively and preprocess the questionnaire data. Secondly, the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation vector of two or more product indicators is calculated. The first level indicator score is obtained, which is compared with the competitive product score. Higher than the competitive product score can be regarded as a comparative advantage and maintained; If it is lower than the competitive product score, the corresponding secondary indicator score will be analyzed to improve in a more specific direction; If it is equal to the competitive product score, or it is in the middle of multiple competitive product scores. Analyze the disadvantages in the secondary indicators and improve them to become advantages.

SECTION VI.

Guidelines for Graphics Preparation and Submission

This research has four innovations: First, it starts from the rapid development of current CG art and the problems that the user experience of relevant CG art communication platform needs to be improved. In addition to the content and quality of works of art, the user experience of the platform is also an important factor that affects creators to actively create, fans to continue to pay attention, and enhance user stickiness. To solve this problem, a new perspective of experience evaluation of visual art platform “curriculum platform user experience” is proposed. Refine dimensions and expanded the field of online platform user experience evaluation. The second aspect is to summarize the initial user evaluation data through grounded theoretical analysis. The four first level indicators of “functional experience”, “content experience”, “emotional experience” and “interactive experience” as well as 16 second level indicators have been summarized, which has developed a new theoretical system of CG art platform user evaluation. The third is to apply the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method to the case study of the model. Using fuzzy vector as evaluation parameter instead of single participant scoring is of great value for solving the problem of strong subjectivity and randomness in user evaluation. The fourth is to create a new model for the analysis of multi product comparison. By comparing the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation vectors of multiple products, the relative advantages and disadvantages are obtained. To provide more scientific guidance for product improvement and optimization.

The experimental objects “Artstation”, “Pinterest” and “GGAC” selected in this study are verified because these three websites have a broad user base in the CG art world. Although “Pinterest” is not a pure CG art platform, it is still representative in the visual art platform. These three websites are places that most CG enthusiasts will set foot in, and they have the basic conditions as experimental objects. As the most recognized communication platform in the industry, “Artstation” has no doubt of its research value. As a representative platform in China, “GGAC” has not only been recognized by users, but also the differences between it and “Artstation” in countries and regions will lead to differences in users’ use patterns. It results in differences in user experience, which is of comparative research value. As one of the representatives of the visual arts platform, “Pinterest” not only maintains the commonness in the CG art field with the above two websites, but also has the characteristics of a wider user experience of the visual arts communication platform, and also has strong comparative research value. Therefore, the example application of the CG art communication platform user experience evaluation system constructed in this paper in these three websites can not only verify the evaluation effect of this system in the CG art field, but also study the difference of CG art platform user experience in different regions and cultural differences. It can also compare the difference of CG art platform user experience with the broader visual art platform user experience.

SECTION VII.

Conclusion

According to the characteristics of CG art communication, this study used grounded theory to collate and summarize the initial data of user evaluation of related platforms. It obtained 4 first level indicators and 16 second level indicators of user experience evaluation of CG art communication platform. Based on the survey data of CG art communication platform. According to the scoring results of many interviewees, the index weight of the evaluation model is obtained according to the analytic hierarchy process. The fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method is used to verify the model by taking “Artstation”, “Pinterest”, and “GGAC” as examples. It proves that the evaluation system has a good evaluation effect on user experience of different types of CG art communication platforms.

In the context of the vigorous development of network information, the development and improvement of CG art platform is of great significance to the continuous progress of CG art. The focus on the platform has gradually shifted from simple content to other aspects. Although the research on user experience of CG art platform is still in its infancy, user experience is bound to become an important part of the construction of CG art platform in the future.
